p: Time series analysis showed no significant changes over time in either plant species richness or the Shannon-Weiner diversity index, whereas Floristic Quality Assessment measures, including the Floristic Quality Index (FQI), Cover-weighted FQI, and the Mean Coefficient of Conservatism (Mean C), all increased dramatically over time (Figs 1– 5). Although statistical significance values for Cover-weighted FQI suggested a weak overall trend, visual examination of the trend confirms that the actual relationship was strong (see below and in “Discussion”).
